intro: Hieracium pallescens subsp. subgelmianum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. It has a taproot system and produces achenes as its seeds. Due to its horticultural interest, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
